itemDescription: Scottish-born mathematician and educator in South Africa (1878–1947)

wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Brown FRSE FRSSAf (1878–1947) was a Scottish-born mathematician and educator in South Africa. He contributed to the study of the ratio of incommensurables in geometry and relations between the distances of a point from three vertices of a regular polygon.

response: *Sandy Brown (footballer, born 1877) (1877–1944), born Alexander Brown, career lasted from 1896 to c. 1914

*Alexander Brown (mathematician) (1878–1947), Scottish mathematician who became an academic in South Africa
*Alexander Brown (author) (1843–1906), American writer who specialized in historical studies of colonial Virginia
